Welcome to Mentor Report’s documentation!¶

Mentor Report main¶

app.py - This module is the entry point into the mentor report

This is the module where routes and defined and where the app is run from.

In order to execute this file, run:

$ python app.py
app.sessions(rate, month, year)¶

Get sessions

The endpoint that will be retrieve the data and return it the caller.

Parameters:
  • rate (int) – The rate of payment per hour
  • month (str) – The month that wish to generate the report for
  • year (str) – The year that wish to generate the report for
Returns:

A JSON representation of the sessions, including the formula that will be used in the Google Sheet
Return type:

JSON

Examples

In order to generate a report with a rate of 50 euro per hour for the month of March, 2020:

$ curl http://127.0.0.1:8080/sessions/50/3/2020

Or, in Python using requests:

>>> import requests
>>> response = requests.get("http://127.0.0.1:8080/sessions/50/3/2020")
>>> response.status_code
200
Example Output:

An example of what the data structure looks like:

[
    {
        "duration": "0:26:00",
        "date": "02/03/2020",
        "total_billable": 21.67,
        "name": "Eamonn Smyth"
    }
]

Mentor Report calculator¶

A helper module that will be responsible for generating the rate of each session, based on the length of the session.

utils.calculator.perform_rate_calculation(duration, rate_per_hour)¶

Wrapper function that will execute the whole process of calculating the total amount payable for a session based on the duration provided from the API
